unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Gym Preferences
question_text: A local gym is studying whether the type of membership (Regular, Premium, VIP) has any association with the choice of workout sessions (Aerobics, Weightlifting, Yoga). For a chi-square test of independence, which of the following sets of hypotheses is appropriate?

choices.text:
$H_0$: Membership type dictates workout session choices.
$H_a$: Membership type has no influence on workout session choices.

$H_0$: Workout session choice and membership type are independent.
$H_a$: Workout session choice and membership type are dependent.

$H_0$: The popularity of Yoga is the same across all membership types.
$H_a$: Yoga is more popular in one membership type compared to others.

$H_0$: Premium members choose Aerobics and Weightlifting equally.
$H_a$: Premium members choose Aerobics more than Weightlifting.

$H_0$: The distribution of workout session preferences is the same for all membership types.
$H_a$: The distribution of workout session preferences is not the same for all membership types.
